msDesc.head: Miscellanea. Germany, A) (fols 1–102) s. xivin; B) (fols 103–166) c.1300; C) (fols 167–174) s. xiii2.

physDesc.p: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 532–548. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

supportDesc.foliation: i, ii, 1–176, in modern (19th-cent.) pencil; leaf between fols 131 and 132 numbered 131a. Medieval (14th-cent.) foliation in arabic numerals at the top right corner of rectos, 25 (fol. 1r) to 198 (fol. 174r).
supportDesc.collation: A) i 10 | ii 12-1 | iii–viii 12 | ix 10-1; B) x 14 | xi and xii 8 | xiii 10 | xiv 14-1 | xv 12; C) xvi 8.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: A miscellany of three different, German, parts, which existed in this form already in the 14th century (see Foliation, above). The 24 leaves missing at the beginning of the volume went lost some time after the foliation was inserted, but before fascicle A, which bears a late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscription of the Mainz Charterhouse, received its quire signatures.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. ii verso.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 163–4 Quarto Catalogue, p. 550 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 34

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 532–548

msItem.author: David of Augsburg
msItem.title: De exterioris et interioris hominis compositione
msItem.note: Lib. III of De exterioris (=De profectu religiosorum), with shortened preface (pr.: GW 4649 (Bonaventure, Opuscula); 8163–8168 (David of Augsburg); ed.: Quaracchi (21899) 161–378, with a list of MSS at pp. xx–xxxiv; Little 178, this copy only; Distelbrink 100; Bloomfield 4283, citing the present MS., and suppl.; Hauréau, Initia, 4. 356rb–va, this copy at col. 356rb; Mohan 304*, citing the present MS).

msItem.author: David of Augsburg
msItem.title: De exterioris et interioris hominis compositione
msItem.note: Lib. i, p. 2 of De exterioris (=Viginti passus de virtutibus bonorum religiosorum ad novitios), with preface (pr.: GW 4644–4648; ed.: Quaracchi (21899) 36–57, with a list of MSS at pp. xx–xxxiv; ed.: SBonO 1 (1882), p. xxi (no. 86); Little 192, citing the present MS).
(fols 74rb–75rb) list of chapter titles, to item 1 only.

msItem.author: Ps.-Bonaventure (James of Milan)
msItem.title: Stimulus amoris
msItem.note: Version maior Ia (augmented, with excerpts), with preface (ed. Peltier I 11.2 21.2 3. 4. II 11-3 3–6. 9. 10. Transfige. III 1, 2/3–5).
(fol. 93va–vb) two prayers, ascribed to Dionysius and Augustine.
(fol. 93va) Ps.-Anselm of Canterbury, orat. 10.
(fol. 102r–v) two entries on praescientia and praedestinatio, and excerpts, ascribed to Augustine and Bernard of Clairvaux.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fol. 79) remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes), (fols 10 and 67) bookmark (parchment strip), now broken off.

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling varies with the hands; in lead point or ink; mostly two columns, of c.25–31 lines. Ruled space
c.110–14 89–94

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xivin, by three hands: A1) (fols 1ra–93vb, l. 16); A2) (fols 93vb, l. 17–102r, l. 15); A3) (fol. 102r, l. 15–v).

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the late 14th-cent. ex-libris inscription at the lower margin of fol. 1r: ‘Iste liber est fratrum montis sancti michahelis prope mogunciam ordinis cartusiensis’. For the leaves missing at the beginning of the volume, see above.

msItem.title: Opusculum volentibus proficere in virtutibus
msItem.note: With prologue (unpr.; ed.: Little 25, citing the present MS.; Hauréau, Initia, 1. 102vb, this copy only; Bloomfield 489, and suppl., both this copy).

msItem.title: De xii fontibus ubi debent religiosi quiescere
msItem.note: Title after the header on fol. 105v.

msItem.title: Libellus considerationum gratiae dei de perfectione spiritualis vitae
msItem.note: With prologue (Little 151, this copy; Hauréau, Initia, 4. 167vb, this copy only).

msItem.author: Bonaventure
msItem.title: De triplici uia
msItem.note: With prologue. Text imperfect, in part different from edition (pr.: GW 4644; 4646–4650; 4705–4708; ed.: SBonO 8 (1898) ix–xxv, with a list of MSS at pp. x ff., 3–16; Glorieux, Rép., 305am; Stegmüller, RB, 10717; Distelbrink 18; Mohan 124*; Bloomfield 1856, and suppl.).
(fol. 122r) Note and verses.

msItem.author: Bonaventure
msItem.title: Lignum uitae
msItem.note: With prologue (pr.: GW 4644, 4646–4649; ed.: SBonO 8 (1898) pp. xxxix–xlix, with a list of MSS at pp. xli ff.,68–86; Little 35; Glorieux, Rép., 305ak; Schneyer, Wegweiser, 67 (prologue); Distelbrink 21; Mohan 51*; Bestul, Passion, 189, no. 16)
(fol. 131vb) Colophons: ‘Qui scripta sua dextera sit benedicta [sic] | Explicit expliceat ludere scriptor eat’.
(fol. 131v) Additional prayers.
Treatise, the head of the page trimmed, with text loss (l.5: 'tractatus status volentis deo placere').
(fol. 131ar) Excerpts, ascribed to Bernard of Clairvaux.

msItem.author: Ps.-Anselm of Canterbury
msItem.title: Meditatio de humanitate Christi (medit. 9)
msItem.note: = Ecbertus Schonaugiensis, Stimulus amoris.

(pr.: GW 2039 and GW 3907–08; ed.: PL 158. 748C–61A, 184. 953D–66A; SBonO 10 (1902) 28f., no. 90; Little 131, ‘Anon. Stimulus Amoris Dei’, citing the present MS.); see also MSS Laud Misc. 22, fols 18r–29r and Laud Misc. 493, fols 53r–57r.

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Meditatio in passionem et resurrectionem domini

msItem.note: Dicta. Authors/works quoted are Bernard of Clairvaux, Gregory the Great, Augustine, Cassidorus, Maximus, the Bible (John, James, etc.), Basilius, Ambrose, and Ephraem.

msItem.author: Bonaventure
msItem.title: Collationes de decem praeceptis
msItem.note: (pr.: GW 4646–4648, 4650; ed.: SBonO 5 (1891) 507–32 (this manuscript siglum ‘B’, see p. xliii), etc.; Bloomfield 5668, citing the present MS., and suppl.).
(fol. 154vb) Two excerpts from Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux, Meditationes piissimae de cognitione humanae conditionis (ed.: PL 184. 493D; – Bloomfield 3126).

msItem.author: William de la Furmentarie (?) (Ps.-Bonaventure)
msItem.title: Pharetra
msItem.note: Imperfect, with prologue ((pr.: GW 4646–4648, 4650; Glorieux, Rép., 305bk and 311t; Distelbrink 178; Mohan 187*; Bloomfield 2530).
(fol. 155ra) table of chapters.

msItem.author: Smaragdus
msItem.title: Diadema monachorum
msItem.note: Imperfect, with prologue (ed.: PL 102. 593C–610B; Bloomfield 2456, citing the present MS., and suppl.).

supportDesc.support: parchment; occasional remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes). (fol. 103) Bookmark, indicating the beginning of fascicle B or item 4 respectively: a parchment strip, glued to both sides of the page, partly broken off.
supportDesc.collation: x 14 | xi and xii 8 | xiii 10 | xiv 14-1 | xv 12. Leaf inserted between fols 131/132 (fol. 131a).

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink, two columns, of c.32–35 lines. Ruled space
c.120–33 90–100

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: see above.

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.note: (ed.: J.-P. Bouhot, ‘Un sermonnaire carolingien’, RHT 4/1974 (1975) 181–223, nos. 35, 36, 51-55; and G. Folliet, ‘Deux nouveaux témoins du Sermonnaire carolingien récemment reconstitué’, RÉAug 23 (1977) 155–198, nos. 48, 50-56).

layoutDesc.layout:
Ruling in ink, two columns of 42 or 43 lines. Ruled space
c.133–138 89–90

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiii2, by a single hand, above top line.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured initials in red and blue.

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: see above.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
